# The Instruction Builders Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

An instruction builder represents a point within a basic block and is the exclusive means of building instructions using the C interface. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

An instruction builder represents a point within a basic block and is the exclusive means of building instructions using the C interface.

<SectionDefinition>

### LLVMCanValueUseFastMathFlags() {#gad206b5bb054cf66b2e5ee97d6c5e03f4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMBool LLVMCanValueUseFastMathFlags (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Check if a given value can potentially have fast math flags.

Will return true for floating point arithmetic instructions, and for select, phi, and call instructions whose type is a floating point type, or a vector or array thereof. See <a href="https://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#fast-math-flags">https://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#fast-math-flags</a>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l04451">4451</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l03829">3829</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetHandlers() {#gaa6b62d81edcc2bf9a3b69b96395d690a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMGetHandlers (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> CatchSwitch, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a> &#42; Handlers)</>}>
Obtain the basic blocks acting as handlers for a catchswitch instruction.

The Handlers parameter should point to a pre-allocated array of LLVMBasicBlockRefs at least <a href="#gacd98387fed53f034d64d384becbc469d">LLVMGetNumHandlers()</a> large. On return, the first <a href="#gacd98387fed53f034d64d384becbc469d">LLVMGetNumHandlers()</a> entries in the array will be populated with <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a> instances.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="CatchSwitch">The catchswitch instruction to operate on.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Handlers">Memory address of an array to be filled with basic blocks.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l04314">4314</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l03556">3556</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMSetInstDebugLocation() {#gaba9a2e38973c7738adeac4b2993a244e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMSetInstDebugLocation (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab13eecdec39366f9974f865d68011775">LLVMBuilderRef</a> Builder, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Attempts to set the debug location for the given instruction using the current debug location for the given builder.

If the builder has no current debug location, this function is a no-op.


<XrefSect
  title="Deprecated"
  permalink="/docs/api/pages/deprecated/#_deprecated000005">
LLVMSetInstDebugLocation is deprecated in favor of the more general LLVMAddMetadataToInst.
</XrefSect>
